p: Pearson's correlation coefficient test was also carried out selecting parameters that showed differences statistically significant among treatments, in order to measure the strength of the correlation among chemical and sensorial results. Generally, a coefficient of about ±0.7 or more indicates a strong correlation, whereas ±0.9 points out a very strong correlation. In the ±0.5 region the correlation is moderate, and in the range –0.3 to +0.3 it is weak ( Leighton et al., 2010).
